ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
ID for the Experiment/settings/run
Misc notes regarding the experiment for this subject
Writing condition for trial
Notes: NMX = Left hand, 8 circles overlaid, MID, Max Speed; NO2 = Left hand, 8 circles overlaid, MID, Normal Speed; DMX = Right hand, 8 circles overlaid, MID, Max Speed; DO2 = Right hand, 8 circles overlaid, MID, normal speed; LL4 = Right hand, 8 loops (lower case L's), BOT, Normal Speed; LL1 = Right hand, 8 loops (lower case L's), TOP, normal speed; SEN = Right hand, "goodbye", MID, Normal Speed; CO2 = Right Hand, "lleellee", MID, Normal Speed

ElementDescription: Trial number
An upward or downward stroke for a trial
Duration of each segment
Positive or negative size of that segment
Peak velocity reached during execution of a given segment
Absolute size of a given segment
Average absolute velocity of a given segment
Normalized jerk for a given segment
Average normalized jerk for a given segment
Number of strokes in a condition
Data file 1
type of data file 1
